author: raz
title: Fund8Proposals + SDGs - Cardano AIM
description: Connecting UN frameworks like the SDGs to Proposals require analyses + evaluation. Support our research work in Fund 8 as in Fund 6.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identifies a clear need and gives a solution that makes sense to fill that need. The identified problem and solution are a good fit for the goals of the challenge. This proposal provides open source information which is beneficial to the catalyst community but also continues on previous work and evaluates SDG alignment of proposals which is a feature already integrated into catalyst. As such it is important to analyze the results from that feature to gain any benefits from it. The overview of existing solutions is also listed as an aim of the challenge. In terms of value beyond the evaluation of a catalyst feature, having information on the sustainable development goals (SDG) of proposals fits well with the values of the Cardano community. I have been involved in the community since 2017 and  in my opinion Cardano has always had an altruistic leaning which is a very positive thing to have and is a strong motivator for community growth. Now I'm sure that not everyone shares these goals as something important but for those who prefer talking about profit then the report that this project aims to generate and make available would be very valuable to the ecosystem in terms of generating a positive image. Major investment firms and large private investors around the world now look to SDGs as a major asset when choosing where to invest. From any way you choose to look at it the $9000 requested in this case is small compared to the return on investment. The KPIs for the challenge make sense since they involve producing information that is open source and help in the evaluation of a current feature as mentioned earlier. I agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: This team is well known to the catalyst community and has worked and produced results on several other funded proposals. The team has all the required skills and experience needed to complete the proposal as written. The skills and expertise of the team can be verified through the links provided in the proposal. The budget for this proposal is clearly identified and broken down into individual costs. Those costs are reasonable. There are timeframes identified for the completion of all elements in the roadmap. There is a good understanding of the risks associated with this proposal and it is good to see that the team understands where the challenges will be when conducting their work and have thought of ways to deal with those challenges. Given this team's experience and record on previous proposals along with everything else listed above I strongly agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides a clear roadmap with reasonable timeframes for the completion of all parts of the proposal. The KPIs are very simple to audit since they are primarily reports and information that will be shared publicly. The team has already shared such documents and reports in previous challenges and provided examples so we already know what the sharing would look like. The KPIs presented make sense to fulfill the aim of the proposal and the connected aims of the broader challenge. Therefore I strongly agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
One of the central goals of the Cardano Protocol is to make the world a fair and better place and to provide the tools to make this possible. A good guideline is the UN's SDGs. The team wants to continue their analysis in our ecosystem and continue to provide tools to the community/update old tools so we can better screen projects for sustainability. 

The team has already succeeded in this, now they want to continue their work. This work can extremely help Cardano by making sure the whole ecosystem is moving in the right direction.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has already proven its competence and has since developed even more, so you can be sure that they can continue this project! The time as well as budget plan are set realistically.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team will make its results publicly available and update the tools in a timely manner, as it has done in previous funding rounds. The given KPIs are suitable to analyze and track the success of the project.

How the team will update the community about the current progress, independent of the final reports, remains open.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe that any tool that will help the funding process is a very important cause. As a CA, I would always like to see the funding process to become as accurate as possible. This will help make sure that the proposals that are reaching the voting stage are well written and have a solid team looking to help the Cardano ecosystem. Cardano AIM has been great at helping implement SDG's into this process. The team realizes that this requires some analysis and team efforts to find the most productive method. I think that this could greatly impact the funding process and to help the right proposers have a chance of receiving funds. For this reason, I give this proposal a 4 out of 5 stars for this category.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has given a great amount of detail in regards to their team members. I was excited to see that the team has over 200+ people that are willing to put work in to help this cause. Given the small amount of funds requested, and the size of the team. I can see this proposal being executed in a quick and secure manner. This will help with scalability in the Cardano protocol and strive for having a decentralized nature. For this reason, I give this section a 4 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: After reading through their roadmap, I think that it will be very beneficial because of the first step. They will come together and look through all of the different fund 8 funded projects and use the information to determine how the team will go about this project. This will help them be successful in carrying out this proposal. I think that with all of the information given, the team will have what it takes to find success with this proposal. For these reasons, I give this section a 4 out of 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: Cardano aligns itself as an eco-friendly blockchain and a world financial operating system. Therefore there is a need to evaluate the projects being funded from the Cardano treasury. Since the number of projects is rising, there is a need for a dedicated study team to carry out the necessary work. In this respect, the proposal is in alignment with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has already carried out this work in Fund 6 and have the necessary experience with respect to the mechanics of the same. The team is also strong and have members from a wide section of the Cardano community. Therefore it is highly likely that the proposal will be compelled successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has projected a fund requirement of 9000USD. This can be considered as pay for two months for a single person. With the number and wide variety of the proposal and projects numbering almost 1000 this amount comes to about 9USD for analysing one successful proposal. This can be considered as a reasonable amount. If the analysis report is published in well-respected publications the real impact of Cardano on the world will be well known to the world.

f6_assessments.q0: A quite valuable proposal. Researching further into the alignment of the Cardano ecosystem and Catalyst proposals with the SDGs will be very beneficial to all the shareholders, including society. The proposal is both in the sense of the challenge and should also be scalable (provided that higher funds will be available with the growth of Catalyst and the ecosystem). Overall this proposal should have a pretty high ROI considering the low budget demanded.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are well-known, trustworthy actors within the catalyst community. I don't have any doubt that they will deliver good work on this proposal. The implementation plan and the budget are both realistic and suffiecient. A very detailed contingency plan is made and a schedule is provided.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability is a bit more difficult here due to the difficulty of the topic. However, in the past the proposers have always presented quite tangible pieces of work, which I assume they will also do this time. In addition to this, the problem and solution descriptions are clear and the deliverables are comprehensible.

solution: Analyze Fund 8 proposals for UN SDGs, Human Rights and Planetary Pressures Human Development Index connections, and publish for open access.
experience: 200+ team of active Cardano community members. AIM team (voter-tool, CA-tool, vCA-Tool, Proposer Tool, SDG Search Tool). Globally diverse, multidisciplinary team of professionals: marketing, partnerships, research, and event planning expertise. Fund 5,6,7 winners.
